xml.p: Introduction: "Why, hello and welcome to our little community, dear! #$b#You can call me 'Granny' if you like.$h" #!String
reject_867: "Oh, I'm sure George would be interested in that!" #!String
reject_866: "That's a very pretty rose, dear. Have you shown it to Emily? It makes me think of her." #!String
pamHouseUpgrade: "Oh, sweetie... that was so nice of you to put Pam up in a beautiful new house!$h#$e#It warms my heart when people take care of each other like that..." #!String
pamHouseUpgradeAnonymous: "Call me a silly old fool... but I think I have an idea who paid for Pam's new house... *wink*" #!String
MovieInvitation: "Oh my! That's so kind of you, dear. Why yes... I'd love to go to the movies!$h#$b#You go on ahead, and I'll meet you at the theater." #!String
Mon: "Oh my! What a lovely day.$u" #!String

Tue: "Don't mind my husband, George. He isn't very friendly to strangers.#$e#If you get to know him better he'll warm up to you.#$e#I'm sure you two could become good friends one day!$h#$e#Since you're so interested in my husband I'll let you in on a little secret: he really likes leeks! You can find them in the mountains this time of year." #!String

Wed: "#$1 evelynGarden1#I saw the most beautiful family of butterflies sunning themselves in the town garden yesterday.$k#$e#The good Mayor put me in charge of the town's public gardens.#$e#I've been working on the town flower beds for weeks, so don't step on them!" #!String
Thu: "I'll be baking cookies today. I like to make flower shapes in the spring.$h#$e#Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days." #!String
Fri: "George spends the whole day in front of that darned television set.#$e#I wish he'd go outside more. Some fresh air would do him good." #!String
Sat: "I used to love looking at the clouds, but I have trouble seeing them these days.#$e# My eyes just don't work as well as they used to.$s" #!String
Sun: "It's nice to be so close to the ocean. The sound of the sea makes going to sleep a lot easier.#$e#As kids we hunted for seashells after the tide went out. Those were the days..." #!String
Tue6: "It's nice of you to take the time to visit George and I.#$e#Without young people around, we'd age much faster.$h" #!String
Event_cookies1: "Thank you!$h" #!String
Event_cookies2: "What was that, dear? I could've sworn you said 'hockey puck'. *sigh* My ears aren't what they used to be.$s" #!String
summer_Mon: "I feel more energetic in this wonderful weather.$u" #!String
summer_Mon_inlaw_Alex: "How's my grandson doing? I imagine he's quite happy living on the farm.#$e#He deserves to be happy... he's a good boy." #!String
summer_Tue: "George is always a little less grumpy in the summer. The warm weather softens his bones.#$e#You might not be able to tell, but I can. I've known him for sixty years!" #!String
summer_Wed: "The good Mayor put me in charge of the town's public gardens.#$e#I've been working on the town flower beds for months, so don't step on them!" #!String
summer_Thu: "I'm going to bake cookies today. They're coconut wonders shaped like little palm trees! Heehee.$h#$e#Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days." #!String
summer_Sat: "Be careful out there, dear. You could get sunburnt!" #!String
summer_Sun: "Sweet peas are in bloom right now.#$e#They've got such a wonderful fragrance, haven't they?" #!String
summer_Thu4: "It seems like we always have more visitors when I start baking cookies.#$e#My mother taught me the recipe." #!String
fall_Mon: "With every year I appreciate the seasons more and more. For young people it's easy to let them slip by." #!String
fall_Tue: "I've been putting raisins in George's oatmeal... but he hasn't said a word. I wonder if he even notices these things?" #!String
fall_Wed: "The good Mayor put me in charge of the town's public gardens.#$e#The fall flowers are delicate, so don't go stomping on them! I know how you kids like to do." #!String
fall_Thu: "Today I'm baking cookies. They're shaped like little pumpkins.$h#$e#Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days." #!String
fall_Sat: "Are you friends with Alex?#$e#Sometime he worries me sick." #!String
fall_Sat_inlaw_Alex: "Oh, hello my dear. I think of you as my own grandson now.$h^Oh, hello my dear. I think of you as my own grand-daughter now.$h" #!String
fall_Sun: "My eyesight may be poor, but my nose hasn't failed me yet!#$e#I can smell fallen leaves and mushrooms. It reminds me of the forests I used to play in as a girl." #!String
winter_Mon: "Be careful you don't slip on the ice, dear." #!String
winter_Tue: "Aren't you cold? You should wear a thicker jacket, my dear!#$e#This weather isn't good for my joints...$s" #!String
winter_Wed: "I usually tend to the gardens, but they're covered in snow.#$e#I still like to check up on them now and then." #!String
winter_Sat: "We've lived here for over 30 years.#$e#We've seen a lot of people come and go. Your grandfather, for one. Bless him... *sigh*" #!String
winter_Sat6: "Oh... my dear. You have your grandfather's eyes...$s#$e#Yes... yes... I knew him very well." #!String
winter_Sun: "You should make some hot soup to stay warm.#$e#And make sure you wear a jacket!" #!String
winter_Sat8: "@, have I told you that George and I have lived in our house for 30 years?#$e#I hope you stay here for a while.$h" #!String
